newsitem.title: UK: Black Sea Novorossiisk, Tuapse oil ports shut.
newsitem.headline: Black Sea Novorossiisk, Tuapse oil ports shut.

text.p: Russia's Black Sea oil ports of Novorossiisk and Tuapse are shut to tanker traffic because of high winds and swell, a shipping source said on Wednesday.
Novorossiisk, the largest export terminal of Russian crude oil, has been shut since 1320 local hours on Tuesday as winds rose to Gale Force 8 and swell rose up to three metres high.
The smaller Tuapse terminal has been closed since late Tuesday.
There were four crude oil tankers and one small fuel oil vessel at anchor at Novorossiisk on Wednesday.
At Tuapse, there were five products tankers -- one loading naphtha and four to load gas oil -- at anchor on Wednesday.
All other Russian oil outlets in the Black Sea and the Baltic were operating normally, the source said.
